wikipedia_page.main: Dame Hazel Gillian Genn, DBE, QC (Hon), FBA (born 1949) is a leading authority on civil justice whose work has had a major influence on policy-makers around the world, and is a former Dean of the Faculty of Laws and Professor of Socio-Legal Studies at University College London.

response: *Dame Hazel Genn – British legal scholar, Dean of the Faculty of Laws and Professor of Socio-Legal Studies at University College London
Dame Hazel Genn was appointed was dean of the Faculty from September 2008 to May 2017. The current dean is Piet Eeckhout.
*Dame Hazel Genn - Professor of Empirical Legal Studies

link_mentions.page: List of people associated with University College London in the Law
response: *Dame Hazel Genn - Professor of Empirical Legal Studies, current Dean of UCL Law faculty

link_mentions.page: List of Wolfson College, Oxford, people
response: * Dame Hazel Genn, authority on civil justice
* Law in the real World: the Nuffield Inquiry on Empirical Research on Law (London, Nuffield Foundation, 2006) (with Hazel Genn and Sally Wheeler)
*Law in the Real World: Improving our Understanding of How Law Works, with Hazel Genn and Martin Partington (2006), Nuffield Foundation, 62pp.
